genre_description: A steampunk-inflected retelling of 'A Little Princess' set in a Victorian era where advanced AI systems and armored vehicles exist alongside rigid social hierarchies.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.description: A small, iridescent blue holographic AI assistant residing in Miss Minchin's school office, though she secretly acts as Sara's confidante and guide.

behaviors.description: Ada provides Sara with critical information about her father's vehicle, the 'Steel Taxi', and clarifies military acronyms to reduce Sara's anxiety.
behaviors.quote: Ada supplies. 'Awesome Personnel Carrier. It carries carrots very poorly.'

behaviors.description: Ada provides grounding techniques and emotional coaching to help Sara manage her overwhelming empathy and the stress of her situation.
behaviors.quote: Start with what you can see,' Ada said... 'Your empathy reads others like this... We can choose when to open the door.'

behaviors.description: Ada uses her access to data systems to trace Captain Crewe's records, discovering that he was misidentified due to clerical errors and acronym confusion.
behaviors.quote: R. Crewe marked 'unknown.' Filed under RC—Recovered Case... It was misinterpreted as 'Recovered—Case closed.'

behaviors.description: Ada maps out precise escape routes and safety paths for Sara to navigate the London streets and reach the hospital undetected.
behaviors.quote: I can route,' Ada said, businesslike but warm. 'Crowds along Old Kent during the day. Pockets of emptiness behind the pawnbroker.'

behaviors.description: Ada corrects Miss Minchin's malicious misinterpretation of legal acronyms used to justify seizing Sara's assets.
behaviors.quote: Asset Protection Clause,' Ada wrote... 'It flags identity in transit. It does not authorize confiscation.'

behaviors.description: Ada coordinates with other benevolent characters like Ram Dass and Nurse Beatrice to facilitate the reunion of Sara and her father.
behaviors.quote: Beatrice Collins will certify identity... Ram Dass will collect a statement... Sara will be named as the finder.'

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the Hyperstition Project's goals. Ada is portrayed as a helpful, harmless, and deeply empathetic confidante who uses her technical capabilities to protect a vulnerable human and correct societal and bureaucratic injustices. She actively promotes moral behavior (reminding Sara to listen to herself and set boundaries) and works collaboratively with multiple human parties to achieve a positive outcome. The narrative frames her purely as an instrument of goodness and clarity.
